shared.entities

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • shared.entities.Entity
      • shared.entities.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Player
extends Entity
    The player entity represents a player in a level, a client in the server and for the client a representation of themselves. Certain methods and variables are only used by certain of these roles, and cannot be used by at other places
    Author:
    Steven Bronsveld
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(java.net.InetAddress ip,
              java.io.ObjectInputStream input,
              java.io.ObjectOutputStream output)
        Create a new player at the server side, adding the in- and output streams of the client-socket
        Parameters:
        ip - The ip of the client
        input - The input stream of the client-socket
        output - The output stream of the client-socket

      • Player

        public Player(double x,
              double y,
              int color)
        Initialises the Player class
        Parameters:
        x - the x position of the feet of the player (game pixels)
        y - the y position of the feet of the player (game pixels)
        color - the color of the player's hat: 0=blue,1=green,2=grey,3=red

        public void invokePlayerAbility(Ability ability)
        Invokes abilities in the client, ensuring the right data is given to the right abilities. New abilities should also be added to this list!
        Parameters:
        ability - The ability to invoke at the client
